newsitem.title: USA: High cotton prices trigger import quota - USDA.
newsitem.headline: High cotton prices trigger import quota - USDA.

text.p: High cotton prices have triggered another special quota permitting entry of 44,900,528 kilograms (98,988,801 lbs), the U.S. Department of Agriculture said Thursday.
The quota, being established on March 8, 1997, applies to cotton purchased not later than June 5, 1997 and entered into the United States not later than Sept. 3 1997, USDA said.
The quota amount is for the period Sept 1996 through Nov 1996.
